item.title: Web Browser Poll
item.dc:creator: SkyBlue
item.description:
For me, two main ones: a weather one that incroporates a current radar map over the UK, and secondly the godsend that is Zotero, which is basically a configurable referencing collection tool. I write a LOT of essays for my course, and with Zotero I can find journal and peer-reviewed articles and not have to worry about spending hours at the end searching for the same articles again, because I can get a quote to back my point up and then carry on searching without having to reference the article there and then, which breaks my concentration. It may be a little specialised compared to a lot of other peoples’ favourite plug-ins, but it’s incredible for me.

TL;DR: Zotero tracks the articles I’ve quoted for essays.

Read full topic

item.title: Web Browser Poll
item.dc:creator: SkyBlue
item.description:
I prefer the look and speed and ‘feel’ of Chrome, but I use Firefox for the extensions. I get the whole point of switching over to encourage the development of them for Chrome, but the extensions speed up my work too much to get rid of them.

item.title: Web Browser Poll
item.dc:creator: gugamilare
item.description:
johnyo:

What browser does one need to have to use the HTML5 player on vimeo.com? Just curious 'cuz the latest Iron (Chrome) doesn’t seem to do it. Haven’t tried the only other browser I have atm (IE6 :trollface

It seems Vimeo uses H.264 (~ mp4) video format. Iron should not be able to play those videos because it does not have the decoder for patent issues, although Chrome has. The decoder for WebM (Google’s video format) is in Chrome dev-channel, which might or (more probably) not be available in Iron, depending on which version or Chromium it is based on. Some (all?) newer videos on Youtube use this format.

Other browsers with H.264 decoder are Safari, IE 9 and IE with Chrome Frame installed, and other browsers with WebM decoders are Firefox 4 and Opera from version 10.6. More on youtube html5 page.

Read full topic

item.title: Web Browser Poll
item.dc:creator: Stormen
item.description:
I went through phase throughout the year… When I started using the internet on a daily basic is was IE (didn’t like NetScape). Then found Opera a year later which was really nice at the time. Then Firefox (it is my main broswer I use for everything). I will use Chome and Safari for times of need. But I did like the way work for customization. Firefox is nice and all the addons are great and the ones i have are updated very so often.

so my vote was clear for FireFox.

Read full topic
